bibl.title: Letter from John Cook Wyllie to Philip Showalter Hench, November 11, 1947

div1.p: Wyllie requests that Hench bring the “New Year's Letter” and the fever charts, and some other Reed items of Hench's choosing, for the Reed exhibit at the University of Virginia.

div1.head: Letter from John Cook Wyllie to Philip Showalter Hench, November 11, 1947
div1.opener:
UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
CHARLOTTESVILLE
ALDERMAN LIBRARY
11 November 1947
DIVISION OF RARE BOOKS
AND
MANUSCRIPTS
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I have been out of town, attending a family wedding,
so I have been delayed in replying to your generous letter of
the 4th. Meanwhile, the reprints have come, but there are still
no signs of the photographs.

The problem of choosing from your magnificent list is
one that I am unable to do with any real satisfaction myself.
I will say, however, that the “New Year's Letter” and the fever
charts alone would be an exhibit in themselves. If you could
bring these two items, adding perhaps some others in your own
judgment, I would be very deeply gratified with the outcome of
the project.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, John Cook Wyllie
Curator of Rare Books Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
